channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10812] Backport HBASE-9426(Make custom distributed barrier procedure pluggable) to 0.98.x
item.description:
Backport HBASE-9426 to better leverage snopshot feature on 0.98.x.

We(IBM) are in process to open source our solution of Backup/Restore through HBASE-7912. The solution is using distributed log roll or distributed table flush and depending on the feature provided by HBase-9426
item.summary: Backport HBASE-9426(Make custom distributed barrier procedure pluggable) to 0.98.x

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: pretty much the same patch of HBase-9426. I cherry-picked the commit and resolved the conflict of HBaseAdmin.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: http:

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9079//console

This message is automatically generated.
the patch is built from 0.98 branch so couldn't be applied to trunk directly. I tested locally.
Oh, duh. Never mind, let me commit this.
Doing a mixed minor version compatibility test wrt snapshots.

Started with 0.98.0 master, 0.98.0 RS x 3, and 0.98.1 RS x 2. Created snapshot, cloned new table from snapshot, deleted snapshot, created snapshot. Restarted master switching over to 0.98.1, cloned new table from snapshot, deleted snapshot.
Andrew Purtell, thank you so much.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #249 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/249/)
